description:
Thermothelomyces heterothallicus CBS 202.75 is a species of filamentous fungus belonging to the phylum Ascomycota. It is a thermophilic organism, meaning it thrives in high-temperature environments, with an optimal growth temperature range of 40-50Â°C.

The species is characterized by its heterothallic nature, which means it requires the fusion of two compatible mating types to undergo sexual reproduction and produce ascospores. The vegetative hyphae are septate, and the asexual spores (conidia) are produced in chains on specialized conidiophores.

Thermothelomyces heterothallicus CBS 202.75 has been isolated from various high-temperature environments, such as compost, soil, and thermal springs. It is known to be involved in the decomposition of plant biomass and has potential applications in the production of thermostable enzymes for industrial processes.
